teams.name: University of South Florida
teams.loan_because: USF is one of 39 U.S. public colleges and universities (the only one in Florida) classified by the Carnegie Foundation as "Community Engaged."  Our commitment to a better world for all remains a strong passion for USF students, faculty, alumni and friends.
teams.description: The University of South Florida is one of the nation's top 63 public research universities.The University has a $1.6 billion annual budget, an annual economic impact of $3.2 billion, and serves more than 45,000 students on campuses in Tampa, St. Petersburg, Sarasota-Manatee and USF Polytechnic. USF is one of only three Florida public universities classified by the Carnegie Foundation for the Advancement of Teaching in the top tier of research activities, a distinction attained by only 2.2 percent of all universities. USF offers 232 degree programs at the undergraduate, graduate, specialist and doctoral levels, including 89 bachelor, 97 master, two ed specialist, 36 research doctoral, and four professional doctoral programs. USF is a member of the Big East Athletic Conference. GO BULLS!!!

teams.name: Unique Coffee
teams.loan_because: We support family-owned farms and co-operatives that produce the finest tasting varieties in the coffee-growing world.
teams.description: Through Kiva, we support the efforts of other forward thinking entrepreneurs to live a better life.

teams.name: Norway
teams.loan_because:
We have Cold Weather - Warm hearts !
We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty. 

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe.
teams.description:
Bruk denne linken for å invitere dine venner til teamet her:
http://www.kiva.org/team/norway/recruit

Det er flott hvis du trykker Facebook "anbefale/recommend" knappen oppe til høyre  på denne siden. Vår facebookgruppe: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Kiva-Norway/193432017389484

Anbefalte lån "sikrere" lån: 
http://www.kiva.org/lend?sortBy=partner_default_min=0&partner_default_max=0.5&partner_risk_rating_min=1&partner_risk_rating_max=5&partner_arrears_min=0&partner_arrears_max=1.1&sortBy=repaymentTerm
Hjelp med "expiring loans": http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans/#fundraising_loans

Hjelp med "postdisbursed" lån:
http://kivatools.com/fundraising/postdisbursedloans

Kiva tools:
https://www.kiva.org/portfolio/collections
http://www.bhodisoft.com/kiva-country-collector/
http://www.bhodisoft.com/kfpc/
http://www.kivalens.org

Da har vi nådd målet på 2 million dollar utlånt. Takk til alle som har bidratt!

teams.name: Nerdfighters
teams.loan_because:
We aim to decrease world suck.

And this is how:
www.eludehcs.no/kiva/nerdfighters/nerdfighters20120916.png by Nerdfighter Ole Bendik
teams.description:
We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/KivaNerds

teams.description: Anyone is welcome to join our group.  The team is just for fun and to help build community.

teams.name: milepoint
teams.loan_because: As travelers we have seen poverty first hand and are committed to making the world a better place for all.
teams.description: Travelers who collect miles and points and seek free flights, hotel rooms and upgrades where possible. Here we seek to give back and invite everyone to join with us and make a difference.

teams.name: Team Obama
teams.loan_because: We understand that our combined efforts through Kiva will help make this world a much better place!
teams.description: http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=127545645

teams.name: LOTUS: Lend Out To Uplift Self-sufficiency
teams.loan_because: We care about people striving to enhance their economic self-sufficiency and wish to support their entrepreneurial endeavors. It just takes one small step by each of us lending on kiva. Together we can make it easier for hard working people to get the much-needed capital to sustain and grow their business. We feel blessed to be able to support the aspirations of so many loan recipients who persevere tenaciously for a better quality of life with dignity. Kudos to Kiva.org that allows us to connect for this common cause.
teams.description:
In our team, we have a vision to change lives in novel ways. Our team's origin began with a Kiva Card (gift certificate) whose recipient founded this team. Inspired by Kiva Fellow, Jessica Heinzelman's talk, our founder dreamed to take us on a cruise, beyond the realm of lending targets and team statistics. Frequent & occasional lenders are free to choose who to lend to, how much and when in an amiable team ambience nurtured by Kiva Fellows, Kiva Editor & Translators, artists, writers, entrepreneurs, workers, retired people, families, parent + kid(s), students, teachers, and professionals. Our diversity & portfolio enable our discovery of social values inherent in the Kiva micro-lending ecosystem whose issues we debate objectively. Experienced members are gratified to enhance our grasp of nuances in lending. We wish to work with volunteers in the team, Kiva Friends, http://kivafriends.org and our supporters to engage in activities that promote Kiva. Our journey to strengthen and grow the Kiva ecosystem has room for more. JOIN NOW, and check out our team, to convince yourself that it can be your team too.

LINKS TO SEE ALSO:
1. Kiva Updates:http://www.kiva.org/updates/kiva 
2. KF Blogs:http://www.kiva.org/updates/fellows 

(Thanks Anh D Pham for letting LOTUS team on Kiva to use the exquisite image of the lotus flower you photographed in Vietnam)

teams.description: Where everyone is a captain!

teams.name: Intuit
teams.loan_because: Intuit is honored to dedicate the efforts of our Kiva lending team to the memory of our friend and colleague Anne Henderson. Anne passed away in September 2010 after a long battle with cancer. She was a bright light to everyone around her and was passionate about helping entrepreneurs through Kiva. We are inspired by her compassion, and are honored to continue her efforts to alleviate poverty. Anne, you will be greatly missed.
teams.description: At Intuit, corporate social responsibility is more than just a business practice, it's a longstanding part of who we are. It's our culture. It's one of our core values: We Care & Give Back. Anyone may join and invite others to join the Intuit lending team.

teams.name: Errante-Menendez
teams.loan_because: God calls us all to share.
teams.description: We are ONE Human Family. This team pledges to share its bounty that others may too enjoy God's bounty.

"Thou shalt share, that none may seek without funding."   A nod to VII.  of “RANDOM NUMBER OF NOT COMMANDMENTS, SUGGESTIONS"  in the LOOSE CANON:

Members of the Church of the Flying Spaghetti Monster  

Secular vs religious Field Partners, see links at http://atheist-monkey.blogspot.de/2009/08/kiva-mfi-checker.html

teams.name: Texas
teams.loan_because: Texas does it bigger!

teams.name: Yahoo! Green
teams.loan_because: Giving people a little exclamation mark in their lives
teams.description: Yahoo! employees, alumni and friends. Loan a little, but make a huge difference.

teams.name: GLBT (Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender) Kivans & Friends
teams.loan_because: We are out and proud and know what it is like to face barriers. We are privileged to help our entrepreneurs achieve their own equality. We thank our friends who join us in our loans & in supporting GLBT rights.
teams.description: We are gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, homosexual, and heterosexual people from all over the world.

teams.name: Utah
teams.description: We are a team of people that want to connect with others that are close to home about our experiences.

teams.name: University of Washington
teams.loan_because: This is a great way for a small individual effort have a huge impact for positive change and growth. Through microfinance and small-credit loans, we give others around the world the chance to realize their potential without removing the freedom of entrepreneurship and good business.
teams.description: The University of Washington (or UDub) is a large public university in Seattle, Washington committed to making a difference.

teams.name: Ravelry.com
teams.loan_because: We want to support crafts people all over the world.
teams.description: We are a group of knitters and crocheters that want to support other crafts people around the world

teams.name: La Crosse
teams.loan_because: We are all connected to each other, no matter where we live or where we are in life.
teams.description: We're a big small town in a beautiful river valley with lots of wonderful, people.

teams.name: Cheeseheads For Change
teams.loan_because: If you give a man a fish, you feed him for a day.  Now in the modern world, you can give that same man a loan to buy a fishing pole, he catches fish with his new pole to feed his family, his community improves because of his financial success, he pays the loan back, and  you can re-loan that money again to help someone else buy a fishing pole . . . wait, that sounds like a conspiracy by the Rapala Corporation to sell more fishing equipment, what are we supporting here ;-)
teams.description: Our Kiva lending team is a non-political group consisting of Green Bay Packers fans lovingly known as Cheeseheads, and anyone who lives in or has ties to the great state of Wisconsin and is interested in making the world a better place.

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.name: Kiva Christians
teams.loan_because:
Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their misfortune and to keep oneself unstained by the world. (Jam. 1:27) http://whoisjesus-really.com/

Link to information regarding Christian partners       
http://goo.gl/LU3hzz
teams.description: A group of believers in Jesus Christ, brought together through a common purpose: to help those in need around the world.

teams.name: Washington State
teams.loan_because: Each of us has a responsibility to all of us.

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Clan Fairbairn
teams.loan_because: Think of these things: whence you came, where you are going, and to whom you must account. (Benjamin Franklin)
teams.description: A family blessed.

teams.name: Kiva Kiwis
teams.loan_because: Because Kiwis know what it is to pull yourself  up by your bootstraps.
teams.description: Started in Oamaru New Zealand by a group of friends wanting to encourage and to make it easy for Kiwis to make loans through Kiva.

teams.name: Nurses and other Health Professionals
teams.loan_because: We care about doing real things to alleviate human suffering.
teams.description: We welcome all health professionals and also those who care about health issues and relieving suffering.  Whoever you are, let's work together to encourage each other in support of Kiva's microloans and the entreprenuers they fund.

teams.name: Kivans Against Cockfighting Loans
teams.loan_because: KACL believes in the power of microloans and the potential of Kiva, but we believe Kiva should not list loans related to Cockfighting (or Dog Fighting, Bull Fighting, or any other blood sports).
teams.description: We want to help people escape poverty, and avoid the promotion and celebration of extreme cruelty.

teams.name: Colbert Nation
teams.loan_because: I am helping my fellow wealthy American friends lighten their swollen pockets to help the rest of the world prosper.
teams.description: Stephen Colbert is the host and executive producer of the Emmy-nominated series on Comedy Central, "The Colbert Report." Touted by the New York Times as "one of the best television shows of the year" and praised as "a must-watch show" by Entertainment Weekly, "The Colbert Report" has garnered ratings and critical success as one of the top shows on television.

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: MIT Sloan
teams.loan_because: We believe that entrepreneurship drives social and economic change in communities around the world.
teams.description: Socially and Environmentally Conscious Entrepreneurs

teams.name: Arizona State University (ASU) Students/Alumni
teams.loan_because: We're Devils that care!
teams.description: College students and alumni of ASU who donate to Kiva.org

teams.name: Taiwan Gives
teams.loan_because: We love the world!
teams.description: Welcome all donors from Taiwan or who love Taiwan. >>  Ilha Formosa - meaning "Beautiful Island" in Portuguese ~ Taiwan Will Touch Your Heart.

teams.name: Team Reddit!
teams.loan_because: We redditors believe change is something that we should all take responsibility for.
teams.description: A group of people from the social news website reddit - started not by reddit admins, but by redditors themselves.

teams.name: Kiva Walk
teams.loan_because: Because we know the benefit of someone providing a 'hand up' both in our work and throughout our life.
teams.description: Founded by a 8.5 month walk across the USA in 2010, the KivaWalk Lending Team is a growing movement of Kiva champions that use walking to teach and instill Kiva's mission while also connecting us to the profound benefits of life at 3mph.

teams.description: For people who are of Basque descent and for people who want to help others.  Have a good day!

teams.name: GLBT (Gay, Lesbian, Bisexual, Transgender) Kivans & Friends
teams.loan_because: We are out and proud and know what it is like to face barriers. We are privileged to help our entrepreneurs achieve their own equality. We thank our friends who join us in our loans & in supporting GLBT rights.
teams.description: We are gay, lesbian, bisexual, transgender, homosexual, and heterosexual people from all over the world.

teams.name: 101 Cookbooks
teams.loan_because: There were nearly a million visits to 101 Cookbooks last month - a statistic that continues to amaze me. As the site has grown over the years, I kept thinking to myself that it would be great to figure out a way for us to affect change as a group - Kiva (with its team lending) is a great way for us to do that.
teams.description: Readers of Heidi Swanson's online recipe journal (blog) 101cookbooks.com

teams.name: Atheists, Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists and the Non-Religious
teams.loan_because: We care about human beings and understand that it takes people to help people.
teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

***TEAM WEBSITE***
http://apluskiva.wordpress.com/

***TEAM RESOURCES***
Secular Loans
http://goo.gl/wtDkJ

Field Partners - Social and Secular Ratings:
www.tinyurl.com/AASFSHNR-MFIs

***OTHER RESOURCES:***
Starfish List:
http://starfish.dynalias.org/

KivaLens:
http://www.kivalens.org/

KivaTools:
http://kivatools.com/

Toolkit for analyzing Kiva data:
http://build.kiva.org/

teams.name: Tampa Bay, Florida
teams.loan_because: We are a diverse group of Kiva members who share a connection by living in the Tampa Bay, Florida area.  We also want to make the world a better place.
teams.description:
The Tampa Bay area includes the following major towns and cities:  



Anna Maria, Apollo Beach, Balm, Belleair, Boca Ciega, Boyette, Bradenton, Brandon, Carrollwood, Citrus Park, Clearwater, Clearwater Beach, Dade City, Dover, Dunedin, Durant, Gibsonton, Gulfport, Indian Rocks Beach, Innisbrook, Land O' Lakes, Largo, Lithia, Longboat Key, Lutz, Kathleen, Madeira Beach, Mango, New Port Richey, Odessa, Oldsmar, Palm Harbor, Palm River, Palma Ceia, Palmetto, Pasco, Pinellas Park, Progress Village, Redington Beach, Riverview, Ruskin, Safety Harbor, Saint Pete Beach, Saint Petersburg, Sarasota, Seffner, Seminole, South Tampa, Sun City Center, Tampa, Tarpon Springs, Temple Terrace, Tierra Verde, Town 'n' Country, Treasure Island, Valrico, West Chase, Wimauma, and Zephyrhills.

teams.name: Late Loaning Lenders
teams.loan_because:
We hate to see loans being left unfunded on 
Kiva. Although most of these loans are 
pre-funded by the Field Partners, the Field
Partners lose out on the capital if a loan
doesn't get funded on Kiva. We believe that 
this will damage the Field Partners in the long 
term and impair their capacity to make loans to new borrowers.

We can't save every red loan, but we try to
make a difference as in the Starfish Story:
http://67.199.70.191/articles/the-starfish-story.aspx
Help us fund loans we're already supporting:
http://www.kiva.org/team/late_loaning_lenders/loans?status=fundRaising


Check out Charlotte's Web: http://starfish.dynalias.org

This watchlist for loans suggested by the team members (starfish + offlist) shows:
* the current position in the popularity ranking (considering pages 1 to 5)
* the timestamp of the most recent loan
* the basket amount
Click magnifier icon for more info.  Or read Charlotte’s post at @Charlotte re: #346848
Also known as "CW," or "Charlotte's Web of Wonders"


We invite you to join us and make a difference, too. Please check the team board at 2 am Kiva time, 7 am Kiva time, 1 pm Kiva time and 6 pm Kiva time to coordinate lending.

See our team fund page:
http://www.kiva.org/lender/kivalllfund
teams.description:
Alan's account of the founding of LLL is on the  team board @Alan re: #260143. Loans that are nearing expiry won't get funded if they don't get noticed. We look for loans that are about to expire by using the Sort By:
"Expiring Soon" option instead of the default "Popularity", and then work to get them funded.

See our team FAQ, linked above (the "Team Website" button, next to our traffic light avatar).

A Team LLL glossary (contributed by team member Tony):

Red Loans: Loans that have less than five days to be funded, identifiable by the red box with the notice that says "Only x days left!" or 
"Only x hours and y minutes left!"

LLL - Late Loaning Lenders: this team, where 
lenders work together to keep loans from 
expiring.

SFDD - Starfish Daily Dozen: Under current 
practice, one of these lists is prepared and 
posted for each day, to help LLL lenders focus 
and coordinate their lending on a targeted 
group of loans (the Starfish or SF). The lists 
are prepared by a group of volunteers who 
seek to be objective in selecting the loans to 
be included in their lists. They also seek to 
spread out the loans in each list over a 24 hour 
period and to share the joy among the Field 
Partners with loans expiring during that period, 
but their efforts are always constrained by the 
choice of loans that are available for inclusion 
in the list. Loans with larger amounts needed 
will be included in the period immediately after 
each Credit Day, when lenders are feeling 
flush, but the lists will become less ambitious 
when the LLL lenders are feeling poor.

GG - Gorgeous Group: The SFDD list-makers usually add one or two of these loans at the end of the SF daily dozen lists. As the name 
implies, only group loans are picked. When it is 
first posted, a typical GG loan will expire two 
days or more after the list is posted. It will 
usually be retained as a GG until it becomes 
Fully Funded or moves into Starfish range. The amount needed when the loan is selected as a GG will vary depending on the time of month.

OPM - Abbreviation for "other people's money."  Our main lending method is to coordinate LLL team members' loans, so that we make several loans to a borrower within a short period of time. This will move the borrower's loan request up in Kiva's "popularity" sort and get the loan noticed by other people (non-members of the LLL team).  Many loans then get their funding completed by loans from those non-LLL members.  By attracting other lenders' attention to our Starfish loans in this way, we multiply the impact of our finite funds, and save more loans from expiring than we otherwise could.

RTR - Reduce the Red: These lists are 
prepared and posted when there are large 
numbers of loans slated to expire in a short 
period of time. "Red" is a reference to the red 
boxes that are added to a loan description 
when the Loan is about to expire without full 
funding.

Bulge: A short period in which a great many loans have their scheduled funding expiration times. This may happen when, for example, the volunteer coordinators at Kiva offer a promo of some kind to the editors & translators, to get them to do a lot of work in a very short period of time. Bulge loans are prime candidates for inclusion in Reduce the Red lists.

BTB - Battling the Boxes: On those days where 
there aren't 12 loans that qualify as "Starfish," the listmakers will include loans that have their red boxes, but more than 24 hours left before their deadline, to make up the 12 loans for the list. The criteria are similar to SF 
loans, i.e., one per field partner and reasonable 
amounts left to fund (not too much; not too 
little), except that these loans may have a longer time left before their expiry date. If they gain good traction on their first BTB day, they may be carried forward. If not ... they stand a second chance as SF.

FF - Fully Funded: This is LLL code for a loan 
that has received all the loans required for it to be removed from the list of loans that are raising funds 
and to move into paying back status.

Lars Ratio: the average funding per hour that is needed for a loan to become fully funded.
(Developed by team member Lars)

Wiedergänger (contributed by Maria) - German expression, literal translation "again walker," meaning "undead," i.e. a person that has died but comes back, aka a zombie. Here it means a loan that disappears from the page, but comes back again because somebody didn't check out their basket.

Ruma sana (contributed by Jouko and Potkukelkka) - Finnish expression, literal translation "ugly words."  It is a phrase to use when you are very frustrated, but want to stop just short of actual cursing -- for example, when the Kiva site repeatedly logs you out when you are trying to rescue an expiring loan at the last second.

See data about all loans currently fundraising on Kiva:
www.kivatools.com
See data about loans that have been mentioned on the LLL board, including the most recent lending activity on each loan:
http://starfish.dynalias.org/
See loans in real time, as they are made:
http://www.http://kivalive.com/index2.php

Lists are posted on the LLL Team message 
board. Join us!

teams.name: HALF THE SKY: Empowering Women
teams.loan_because: we believe empowering women is the key to alleviating social injustice and achieving world stability.
teams.description:
Inspired by the book HALF THE SKY written by Nicholas Kristof and Sheryl WuDunn, our team is committed to helping curb culturally accepted abuse of women around the world.

Facebook page: http://www.facebook.com/HALFTHESKYEmpoweringWomenKIVATeam

teams.name: Heartland Oklahoma Team
teams.loan_because: Oklahomans are always willing to lend a hand to our neighbors as well as to total strangers.
teams.description: An active team of Oklahomans joining together to fund loans, work toward goals, and have fun with Kiva loan challenges.

teams.name: Team Ottawa
teams.loan_because: We can make a difference! Parce qu'on peut faire une difference!
teams.description: We are lenders from the region of Canada's capital!  Nous sommes des preteurs de la region de la capitale du Canada!

teams.name: UBank
teams.loan_because: We like to give something back
teams.description: We're an Australia bank.

teams.name: Telstra
teams.loan_because: We are the people behind Telstra. If you work at Telstra, why not join this lending team
teams.description: We are Australia's leading telecommunications and information services company, with one of the best known brands in the country.

teams.name: Unitarian Universalists
teams.loan_because:
We believe in:
**The inherent worth and dignity of every person
**Justice, equity and compassion in human relations
**Acceptance of one another and encouragement to spiritual growth in our congregations
**A free and responsible search for truth and meaning
**The right of conscience and the use of the democratic process within our congregations and in society at large
**The goal of world community with peace, liberty, and justice for all
**Respect for the interdependent web of all existence of which we are a part.
teams.description:
We are UU congregations and individuals (including those who describe themselves as "active" or "backslid" or "interested friends" or "just looking") throughout the world. 
For more information on us, or to find a congregation near you, check out the main website for the Unitarian Universalist Association

teams.name: Women For Women International
teams.loan_because: We are supporters of Women For Women International (WFWI), which helps women survivors of war rebuild their lives.  Some of us are sponsors of "sisters" who are learning life skills, job skills, and rights training through WFWI.
teams.description: We lend especially to women entrepreneurs in countries where WFWI works to help women survivors of war rebuild their lives:  Afghanistan, Bosnia and Herzegovina, Democratic Republic of the Congo, Iraq, Nigeria, Rwanda, and Sudan.

teams.name: St. Mel School
teams.loan_because: Even kids can make a better world!
teams.description: We are a bunch of elementary and middle school students who want to help people improve their lives.

teams.loan_because: We understand that our combined efforts through Kiva will help make this world a much better place!
teams.description: http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=127545645

teams.name: Musicians for Kiva
teams.loan_because: We enjoy improving quality of life through Kiva and through music.
teams.description: We are an open group of musicians who believe in the Kiva mission.

teams.name: Texas A&M Alumni
teams.loan_because: The Aggie family is built around passion, generosity, and spirit.  Aggies can and do make a difference in every way possible, including Kiva.
teams.description: We are alumni of Texas A&M University.

teams.name: Nerdfighters
teams.loan_because:
We aim to decrease world suck.

And this is how:
www.eludehcs.no/kiva/nerdfighters/nerdfighters20120916.png by Nerdfighter Ole Bendik
teams.description:
We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/KivaNerds

teams.name: Colette Patterns
teams.loan_because: We are women and men who sew, helping our fellow sewists.

teams.name: MIT Sloan
teams.loan_because: We believe that entrepreneurship drives social and economic change in communities around the world.
teams.description: Socially and Environmentally Conscious Entrepreneurs

teams.name: Bellevue College Team
teams.loan_because: The best form of education is leading by example!
teams.description: We are all employees, students, or alumni of Bellevue College, located in the Puget Sound Basin.

teams.name: UMHB Against Poverty
teams.loan_because: As the UMHB community we can help alleviate poverty through lending to microentrepreneurs.
teams.description: Students, faculty, staff, alumni and friends of UMHB.

teams.name: Kiva Christians
teams.loan_because:
Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their misfortune and to keep oneself unstained by the world. (Jam. 1:27) http://whoisjesus-really.com/

Link to information regarding Christian partners       
http://goo.gl/LU3hzz
teams.description: A group of believers in Jesus Christ, brought together through a common purpose: to help those in need around the world.

teams.name: Haiti Friends
teams.loan_because: we have friends in need in Haiti.
teams.description: People who care about the plight of our friends in Haiti, especially at this time when food is at record-high prices and many are suffering the effects of the recent hurricane.

teams.name: Webcomics
teams.loan_because: Many of us are small business owners, and we would like to support other entrepreneurs in less fortunate situations.
teams.description: Our team is made up of webcomic creators and readers.

teams.name: pALS = Person with ALS - Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis
teams.loan_because: Because we can!
teams.description:
Just what is ALS? Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) is a motor neuron disease, first described in 1869 by the noted French neurologist Jean-Martin Charcot. Although the cause of ALS is not completely understood, the last decade has brought a wealth of new scientific understanding about the disease that provides hope for the future.

Lou Gehrig first brought national and international attention to the disease in 1939 when he abruptly retired from baseball after being diagnosed with ALS. Most commonly, the disease strikes people between the ages of 40 and 70, and as many as 30,000 Americans have the disease at any given time. ALS has cut short the lives of other such notable and courageous individuals as Hall of Fame pitcher Jim "Catfish" Hunter, Senator Jacob Javits, actors Michael Zaslow and David Niven, creator of Sesame Street Jon Stone, boxing champion Ezzard Charles, NBA Hall of Fame basketball player George Yardley, pro football player Glenn Montgomery, golfer Jeff Julian, golf caddie Bruce Edwards, musician Lead Belly (Huddie Ledbetter), photographer Eddie Adams, entertainer Dennis Day, jazz musician Charles Mingus, composer Dimitri Shostakovich, former vice president of the United States Henry A. Wallace and U.S. Army General Maxwell Taylor.

teams.name: Stodgy
teams.loan_because: It's the right thing to do.  Small business success is vital to sustainable development in emerging economies.  We haven't found a better vehicle to promote this growth than Kiva.
teams.description: We encourage our customers and friends to make loans to further economic growth.  As a small business, we understand that access to capital is vital, and we'd like to do our part to pay-it-forward.

teams.name: women empowering women
teams.loan_because: empower a woman, change the world.

teams.name: ACT_Alumni
teams.loan_because: Helping others through Kiva is such a great way to blend two of our core principals, Gratitude and Service.
teams.description: ARTbundance Coaches and Practitioners believe wholeheartedly in Creative Solutions and are guided by 9 Principles: Gratitude, Intuition, Vision, Balance, Attraction, Action Choice, Connection, Service (GIVBAACS) In our practices, Prosperity and Abundance of ALL kinds are emphasized and celebrated.

teams.name: 101 Cookbooks
teams.loan_because: There were nearly a million visits to 101 Cookbooks last month - a statistic that continues to amaze me. As the site has grown over the years, I kept thinking to myself that it would be great to figure out a way for us to affect change as a group - Kiva (with its team lending) is a great way for us to do that.
teams.description: Readers of Heidi Swanson's online recipe journal (blog) 101cookbooks.com

teams.name: rockroom
teams.loan_because: As a community of wine lovers getting together to make and share wine, we appreciate the chance to join a community of lenders funding the entrepreneurial dreams of the developing world.
teams.description: Rockroom Winemaking Cooperative makes super-premium wine for ourselves and our growing circle of friends.

teams.name: Pittsburgh
teams.loan_because: Pittsburghers understand hard work. We support the idea of opportunity for all people.
teams.description:
The Kiva Pittsburgh team is made up of progressive Pittsburgh natives, transplants and others who love the city. We look forward to hosting events for current Kiva loaners and those interested in Kiva.

We come together to make a change in our world.

Follow us on Twitter: http://twitter.com/KivaPittsburgh

Check us out on Facebook:
www.facebook.com/KivaPittsburgh

teams.name: Supporters of Azerbaijan
teams.loan_because: we care / can / should
teams.description:
A team for people interested in supporting borrowers in Azerbaijan.

Some sample sites:
 * http://www.trekearth.com/gallery/Asia/Azerbaijan/
 * http://www.pbase.com/mcbit/azerbaijan
 * http://www.hansrossel.com/photos/azerbaijan/
* http://www.world66.com/europe/azerbaijan/
*http://www.eurasianet.org/
    THE source for up-to-date news of Central Asia...economic, political, cultural....will help you make sense of this complex part of the world.

teams.name: The Nguyening Family
teams.loan_because: Because even a little can mean a lot!
teams.description: Generously Humorious

Alan's account of the founding of LLL is on the  team board @Alan re: #260143. Loans that are nearing expiry won't get funded if they don't get noticed. We look for loans that are about to expire by using the Sort By:
"Expiring Soon" option instead of the default "Popularity", and then work to get them funded.

See our team FAQ, linked above (the "Team Website" button, next to our traffic light avatar).

A Team LLL glossary (contributed by team member Tony):

Red Loans: Loans that have less than five days to be funded, identifiable by the red box with the notice that says "Only x days left!" or 
"Only x hours and y minutes left!"

LLL - Late Loaning Lenders: this team, where 
lenders work together to keep loans from 
expiring.

SFDD - Starfish Daily Dozen: Under current 
practice, one of these lists is prepared and 
posted for each day, to help LLL lenders focus 
and coordinate their lending on a targeted 
group of loans (the Starfish or SF). The lists 
are prepared by a group of volunteers who 
seek to be objective in selecting the loans to 
be included in their lists. They also seek to 
spread out the loans in each list over a 24 hour 
period and to share the joy among the Field 
Partners with loans expiring during that period, 
but their efforts are always constrained by the 
choice of loans that are available for inclusion 
in the list. Loans with larger amounts needed 
will be included in the period immediately after 
each Credit Day, when lenders are feeling 
flush, but the lists will become less ambitious 
when the LLL lenders are feeling poor.

GG - Gorgeous Group: The SFDD list-makers usually add one or two of these loans at the end of the SF daily dozen lists. As the name 
implies, only group loans are picked. When it is 
first posted, a typical GG loan will expire two 
days or more after the list is posted. It will 
usually be retained as a GG until it becomes 
Fully Funded or moves into Starfish range. The amount needed when the loan is selected as a GG will vary depending on the time of month.

OPM - Abbreviation for "other people's money."  Our main lending method is to coordinate LLL team members' loans, so that we make several loans to a borrower within a short period of time. This will move the borrower's loan request up in Kiva's "popularity" sort and get the loan noticed by other people (non-members of the LLL team).  Many loans then get their funding completed by loans from those non-LLL members.  By attracting other lenders' attention to our Starfish loans in this way, we multiply the impact of our finite funds, and save more loans from expiring than we otherwise could.

RTR - Reduce the Red: These lists are 
prepared and posted when there are large 
numbers of loans slated to expire in a short 
period of time. "Red" is a reference to the red 
boxes that are added to a loan description 
when the Loan is about to expire without full 
funding.

Bulge: A short period in which a great many loans have their scheduled funding expiration times. This may happen when, for example, the volunteer coordinators at Kiva offer a promo of some kind to the editors & translators, to get them to do a lot of work in a very short period of time. Bulge loans are prime candidates for inclusion in Reduce the Red lists.

BTB - Battling the Boxes: On those days where 
there aren't 12 loans that qualify as "Starfish," the listmakers will include loans that have their red boxes, but more than 24 hours left before their deadline, to make up the 12 loans for the list. The criteria are similar to SF 
loans, i.e., one per field partner and reasonable 
amounts left to fund (not too much; not too 
little), except that these loans may have a longer time left before their expiry date. If they gain good traction on their first BTB day, they may be carried forward. If not ... they stand a second chance as SF.

FF - Fully Funded: This is LLL code for a loan 
that has received all the loans required for it to be removed from the list of loans that are raising funds 
and to move into paying back status.

Lars Ratio: the average funding per hour that is needed for a loan to become fully funded.
(Developed by team member Lars)

Wiedergänger (contributed by Maria) - German expression, literal translation "again walker," meaning "undead," i.e. a person that has died but comes back, aka a zombie. Here it means a loan that disappears from the page, but comes back again because somebody didn't check out their basket.

Ruma sana (contributed by Jouko and Potkukelkka) - Finnish expression, literal translation "ugly words."  It is a phrase to use when you are very frustrated, but want to stop just short of actual cursing -- for example, when the Kiva site repeatedly logs you out when you are trying to rescue an expiring loan at the last second.
